title: National grid loses 370MW as two power plants shut down
content: The Sapugaskanda and Yugadanavi power plant have been forced to shut down due to the lack of fuel, resulting in the national grid losing 370 megawatts of electricity. Although this shortage could be covered by hydropower generation during the day, it is reported that this situation could disrupt the power supply during the night.The countryâ€™s electricity demand had risen to a maximum of 2,470 MW yesterday (19), despite it being a Saturday.
